bio:treatment.description: Herbs or subshrubs, perennial, to 0.5 m. Stems ascending to erect, with stellate 0.1 mm hairs and glandular hairs. Leaves: stipules free from petiole, 1-veined, subulate, 3–4 mm, 1/2–1 times length of petiole; petiole 6.3–40 mm, 1/4–1/2 length of blade, minutely stellate-hairy; blade narrowly linear, 2.5–8 cm, 6–20 times longer than wide, base truncate, margins dentate to base, apex subacute, surfaces stellate-hairy. Inflorescences axillary
bio:treatment.discussion: Flowering spring–fall. Arid shrublands, often on limestone; 1000–1800 m; Tex.; Mexico (Coahuila).
Sida longipes is known from at least six counties in the Big Bend region of southwestern Texas.
